column1: The Desolation of the Morannon was the dead land that lay just before walls of Mordor south of the Dagorlad.  It was a place of horror for absolutely nothing grew in the polluted soil.  Pools of water were choked with ash and muds
column2: mounds of crushed and powered rock abounded
column3: and cones of earth fire-blasted and stained with poison rose as if they were part of a graveyard.  The terrible barrenness of the landscape was due to the labours of Saurons slaves
column4: who had so defiled the land that it was diseased beyond repair.

column3: reached the Desolation of the Morannon on 4 March
